intro: Chondrolaena dentata, commonly known as the toothed chondrolaena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves that have serrated edges. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Chondrolaena dentata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
